metadata.title: W3Schools.com
metadata.Keywords: HTML, Python, CSS, SQL, JavaScript, How to, PHP, Java, C, C++, C#, jQuery, Bootstrap, Colors, W3.CSS, XML, MySQL, Icons, NodeJS, React, Graphics, Angular, R, AI, Git, Data Science, Code Game, Tutorials, Programming, Web Development, Training, Learning, Quiz, Exercises, Courses, Lessons, References, Examples, Learn to code, Source code, Demos, Tips, Website
metadata.Description: Well organized and easy to understand Web building tutorials with lots of examples of how to use HTML, CSS, JavaScript, SQL, Python, PHP, Bootstrap, Java, XML and more.
metadata.og:description: W3Schools offers free online tutorials, references and exercises in all the major languages of the web. Covering popular subjects like HTML, CSS, JavaScript, Python, SQL, Java, and many, many more.
metadata.keywords: HTML, Python, CSS, SQL, JavaScript, How to, PHP, Java, C, C++, C#, jQuery, Bootstrap, Colors, W3.CSS, XML, MySQL, Icons, NodeJS, React, Graphics, Angular, R, AI, Git, Data Science, Code Game, Tutorials, Programming, Web Development, Training, Learning, Quiz, Exercises, Courses, Lessons, References, Examples, Learn to code, Source code, Demos, Tips, Website

content.text: AppML Prototype
In this chapter, we will build a prototype for a web application.
content.html: In this chapter, we will build a prototype for a web application.

content.text: Create an HTML Prototype
First, create a decent HTML prototype , using your favorite CSS.
content.html: First, create a decent HTML prototype, using your favorite CSS.

content.text: We have used W3.CSS in this example:
content.html: We have used W3.CSS in this example:

content.code_html:
<!DOCTYPE html>
<html lang="en-US">

<title>Customers</title>
<link rel="stylesheet" href="https://www.w3schools.com/w3css/4/w3.css">

<body>

<div class="w3-container">
<h1>Customers</h1>
<table class="w3-table-all">
  <tr>
    <th>Customer</th>
    <th>City</th>
    <th>Country</th>
  </tr>
  <tr>
    <td>{{CustomerName}}</td>
    <td>{{City}}</td>
    <td>{{Country}}</td>
  </tr>
</table>
</div>

</body>
</html>

content.text: {{ ... }} Are placeholders for future data.
content.html: {{ ... }} Are placeholders for future data.

content.text: Add AppML
After you have created an HTML prototype, you can add AppML:
content.html: After you have created an HTML prototype, you can add AppML:

content.code:
Customers

                               
CustomerCityCountry
{{CustomerName}}{{City}}{{Country}}
content.code_html:
<!DOCTYPE html>
<html lang="en-US">
<title>Customers</title>
<link rel="stylesheet" href="https://www.w3schools.com/w3css/4/w3.css">
<script src="https://www.w3schools.com/appml/2.0.3/appml.js"></script>
<script src="https://www.w3schools.com/appml/2.0.3/appml_sql.js"></script>
<body>

<div class="w3-container" appml-data="customers.js">
<h1>Customers</h1>
<table class="w3-table-all">
  <tr>
    <th>Customer</th>
    <th>City</th>
    <th>Country</th>
  </tr>
  <tr appml-repeat="records">
    <td>{{CustomerName}}</td>
    <td>{{City}}</td>
    <td>{{Country}}</td>
  </tr>
</table>
</div>

</body>
</html>

content.text: Add AppML:
content.html: Add AppML:

content.text: <script src="https://www.w3schools.com/appml/2.0.3/appml.js">
content.html: <script src="https://www.w3schools.com/appml/2.0.3/appml.js">

content.text: Add a local WebSQL database:
content.html: Add a local WebSQL database:

content.text: <script src="https://www.w3schools.com/appml/2.0.3/appml_sql.js">
content.html: <script src="https://www.w3schools.com/appml/2.0.3/appml_sql.js">

content.text: Define a data source:
content.html: Define a data source:

content.text: appml-data="customers.js"
content.html: appml-data="customers.js"

content.text: Define the HTML element to be repeated for each record in records:
content.html: Define the HTML element to be repeated for each record in records:

content.text: appml_repeat="records"
content.html: appml_repeat="records"

content.text: To make it simple, start with local data like customers.js before connecting to a database.
content.html: To make it simple, start with local data like customers.js before connecting to a database.

content.text: Create an AppML Model
To be able to use a database, you will need an AppML database model:
content.html: To be able to use a database, you will need an AppML database model:

content.code_html:
{
"rowsperpage" : 10,
"database" : {
"connection" : "localmysql",
"sql" : "Select * from Customers",
"orderby" : "CustomerName",
}

content.text: If you don't have a local database, you can use the AppML model to create a Web SQL database.
content.html: If you don't have a local database, you can use the AppML model to create a Web SQL database.

content.text: To create a table with a single record, use a model like this: proto_customers_single.js .
content.html: To create a table with a single record, use a model like this: proto_customers_single.js.

content.text: Creating a local database does not work in IE or Firefox. Use Chrome or Safari.
content.html: Creating a local database does not work in IE or Firefox. Use Chrome or Safari.

content.text: Use the model in your application. Change the data source to local?model=proto_customers_single :
content.html: Use the model in your application. Change the data source to local?model=proto_customers_single:

content.code_html:
<div class="w3-container" appml-data="local?model=proto_customers_single">
<h1>Customers</h1>
<table class="w3-table-all">
  <tr>
    <th>Customer</th>
    <th>City</th>
    <th>Country</th>
  </tr>
  <tr appml-repeat="records">
    <td>{{CustomerName}}</td>
    <td>{{City}}</td>
    <td>{{Country}}</td>
  </tr>
</table>
</div>

content.text: Create a Local Database with Multiple Records
To create a table with multiple records, use a model like this: proto_customers_all.js .
content.html: To create a table with multiple records, use a model like this: proto_customers_all.js.

content.text: Change the data source to local?model=proto_customers_all
content.html: Change the data source to local?model=proto_customers_all

content.code_html:
<div class="w3-container" appml-data="local?model=proto_customers_all">
<h1>Customers</h1>
<table class="w3-table-all">
  <tr>
    <th>Customer</th>
    <th>City</th>
    <th>Country</th>
  </tr>
  <tr appml-repeat="records">
    <td>{{CustomerName}}</td>
    <td>{{City}}</td>
  <td>{{Country}}</td>
  </tr>
</table>
</div>

content.text: Add a Navigation Template
Suppose you want all your applications to have a common navigation toolbar:
content.html: Suppose you want all your applications to have a common navigation toolbar:

content.text: Create an HTML template for it:
content.html: Create an HTML template for it:

content.code_html:
<div class="w3-bar w3-border w3-section">
<button class="w3-button" id='appmlbtn_first'>❮❮</button>
<button class="w3-button" id='appmlbtn_previous'>❮</button>
<button class="w3-button w3-hover-none" id='appmlbtn_text'></button>
<button class="w3-button" id='appmlbtn_next'>❯</button>
<button class="w3-button" id='appmlbtn_last'>❯❯</button>
<button class="w3-btn ws-green" id='appmlbtn_query'>Filter</button>
</div>

<div id="appmlmessage"></div>

content.text: Save the template in a file with a proper name like "inc_listcommands.htm".
content.html: Save the template in a file with a proper name like "inc_listcommands.htm".

content.text: Include the template in your prototype with the attribute appml-include-html :
content.html: Include the template in your prototype with the attribute appml-include-html:

content.code_html:
<div class="w3-container" appml-data="local?model=proto_customers_all">
<h1>Customers</h1>
<div appml-include-html="inc_listcommands.htm"></div>

<table class="w3-table-all">
  <tr>
    <th>Customer</th>
    <th>City</th>
    <th>Country</th>
  </tr>
  <tr appml-repeat="records">
    <td>{{CustomerName}}</td>
    <td>{{City}}</td>
    <td>{{Country}}</td>
  </tr>
</table>
</div>
